SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player

Class Library

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Player.Library
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Library extends Object implements Serializable
Library class contains methods related to all actions which are controlled by the library of each player. The main responsibilities are related to the insertion of new cards, counting adjacency points and checking if the library is full.
Author:
Alberto Aniballi
See Also:

    It counts the number of cards that are identified as neighbours of the parameter, using a recursive approach NOTE: a neighbour of a X card is a card that has the same color of X, also it needs to be close to another neighbour of X, or X itself

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library()
      Constructor of Library instances Creates an empty matrix of ObjectCards

  • Method Details

    • getSatisfiedGoal

      public boolean[] getSatisfiedGoal()
      It gets a boolean vector that indicates which cards are already satisfied
      Returns:
      boolean vector with 2 cells, if the cell with index i is false means that the i card has never been satisfied by the player who owns the library

    • satisfyCommonGoal

      public void satisfyCommonGoal(int index)
      It sets the card identified by the parameter as satisfied
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the commonGoalCard to be set as satisfied

    • getNumberOfColumns

      public int getNumberOfColumns()
      It gets the library number of columns
      Returns:
      number of library columns

    • getNumberOfRows

      public int getNumberOfRows()
      It gets the library number of rows
      Returns:
      number of library rows

    • getMatrix

      public ObjectCard[][] getMatrix()
      It gets a matrix of object cards that represent the library
      Returns:
      matrix of object cards that represent the library

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      It checks if the library is full
      Returns:
      boolean that is true if the library is full, otherwise false

    • findNumberOfFreeCells

      public int findNumberOfFreeCells(int column)
      It counts the number of available free cells of a specific column
      Parameters:
      column - the specific column where we have to count the number of free cells
      Returns:
      an integer that represents the number of free cells in a column

    • insertCardsInLibrary

      public void insertCardsInLibrary(int chosenColumn, ObjectCard... cards) throws InvalidMoveException
      It inserts the cards passed as arguments into a specific column starting from the first available cell
      Parameters:
      chosenColumn - the specific column where we insert cards
      cards - array containing the object cards to be inserted in the order of insertion
      Throws:
      InvalidMoveException - if the cards array has not been successfully inserted into the library

    • isMoveAvailable

      public boolean isMoveAvailable(int chosenColumn, int numOfCards)
      Checks if an array of cards can be inserted into a specific column.
      Parameters:
      chosenColumn - the column to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the array of cards fits into the column selected

    • countNeighbours

      public int countNeighbours(int startRow, int startColumn, HashSet<Position> checkedCells)
      It counts the number of cards that are identified as neighbours of the parameter, using a recursive approach NOTE: a neighbour of a X card is a card that has the same color of X, also it needs to be close to another neighbour of X, or X itself
      Parameters:
      startRow - the row where the current cell is
      startColumn - the column where the current cell is
      Returns:
      integer that represents the number of neighbours of the passed cell

    • countAdjacentPoints

      public int countAdjacentPoints()
      It returns the amount of points based on the number of groups of adjacent card found in the library
      Returns:
      integer that represents the number of adjacency points due to object cards in the library
